page.title: 05BARSHAW HOSPITAL - PAISLEY
page.content:
Barshaw Hospital was built about 1875. It was a family home, a hospital for the wounded in 1915, a maternity hosp- ital and now is used for old ladies who cannot look after themselves. The Arthurs, who owned all of Barshaw, gave the land to the council for a park, the old folk have pleasant surroundings. It has 6 large wards divided into about 20 rooms. The patients live there comfortably for the rest of their lives. They knit, sew, paint and draw. They have four common rooms for hobbies and watching T.V.
There is a matron, 10 nurses, 2 doc- tors who visit weekly and kitchen and cleaning staff to look after the 157 patients. One old lady said that she liked the staff and although happy would like to be home- free to go out.
